Consecrate Ability to God 

     Young men and young women should place themselves in our schools, in the channel where knowledge and discipline may be obtained. They should consecrate their ability to God, become diligent Bible students, that they may be fortified against erroneous doctrine, and not be led away by the error of the wicked; for it is by diligent searching of the Bible that we obtain a knowledge of what is 
                                                                           186
truth. By the practice of the truth we already know, increased light will shine upon us from the holy Scriptures. . . .
